Going to make an RFC for this assuming nothing earth-shattering happens in the thread, but in the meantime posting here. Please comment on the internals thread, not here. https://internals.rust-lang.org/t/pre-rfc-stable-rustdoc-urls/13099/1
ping @RalfJ @scottmcm who expressed some interest in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/55160
(maybe this should have been in #t-lang ?)

No, this is tools/docs/something. While I like the idea, it has nothing to do with the language itself. (If you wanted to make a rust compiler you could just not have rustdoc and still legitimately claim to have a rust compiler.)

If you wanted to make a rust compiler you could just not have rustdoc and still legitimately claim to have a rust compiler.

oh hmm, I wasn't aware it was optional. does that mean all the tools are optional and you just need rustc itself?
cargo "just" reads Cargo.toml and invokes rustc appropriately, so that's actually optional.

@Joshua Nelson The more "official" answer is that the tools are the domain of https://www.rust-lang.org/governance/teams/dev-tools and not of lang.

The tools are of course an important part of the ecosystem, but they're foundationally different from the language. For example, there's no stability promise in the generated documentation. And I could imagine someone being willing to use existing rustfmt and friends (because the output is visible) even if they insisted on making their own compiler (maybe because they have specific trusted-computing-base requirements).

For example, there's no stability promise in the generated documentation.

Well, that's kind of the point of this RFC
but I understand your point is that the formatting can change without warning
@Jacob Pratt I noticed you reacted with :confused: on the RFC - are you not sure why I made the RFC? Or not sure that it's an improvement?
(didn't want to call you out on the RFC itself :P)

Not an issue! Consider it a "-0.5". I fully understand what's being proposed, and have been following it on internals as well. I don't have any technical objections whatsoever, just a general "is this actually an issue" kind of feeling.
fyi @RalfJ @scottmcm I'm probably not going to put much more effort into this RFC, if you want to see it accepted feel free to take it over
That's fair. I am also unlikely to push for it, there are things that have higher priority for me.
